solution: We are given that $\frac{9}{\text{S}}=\frac{\text{S}}{\text{T}}=3.$ \[\frac{9}{\text{S}}=3\] gives us $S=3,$ so \[\frac{\text{S}}{\text{T}}=3\] gives us $T=1$. There are 8 shaded squares with side length $\text{T}$ and there is 1 shaded square with side length $\text{S},$ so the total shaded area is $8\cdot(1\cdot1)+1\cdot(3\cdot3)=8+9=\boxed{17}.$
